attributes.GoodForMeal: {'dessert': False, 'latenight': False, 'lunch': False, 'dinner': True, 'brunch': False, 'breakfast': False}
attributes.Ambience: {'touristy': False, 'hipster': False, 'romantic': False, 'divey': False, 'intimate': True, 'trendy': False, 'upscale': False, 'classy': True, 'casual': False}

text:
Delicious food and great service! That's all you need to know! 

Came there for an early dinner because we skipped lunch so us 5 ladies were a bit demanding, sorry! But Quyen and the others delivered! They were attentive, friendly and easy going! Love it!!

The food was delicious; large portions but we also ordered a whole bunch of apps sooo that might have filled us up as well before the main entrees. All in all, we'd definitely go there again! 

Here's what we ordered and I can honestly say, I'd recommend all of it!  

-spaghetti bolognese.. because you always have to try it at an Italian restaurant 
-the seafood white wine spaghetti pasta one (I forgot what it's call in Italian)
-gnocchi with shrimp.. those were some jumbo a$$ shrimps
-chicken Parmesan
-beets salad
-caesar salad
-burrata salad
-tiramisu
-cappuccino 

Definitely finish off your lovely meal with their tiramisu and Quyen made us his infamous cappuccinos, yum!! Soo good!  Such a hidden gem. I'm glad we randomly dropped by after an airport drop off!

6, 7, 8, 9, 10 stars!!!!! My friend and I complimented our meal the entire time! I left dinner and immediately made reservations to bring other people back!

This is a tiny hidden gem in South Philly! There are not many tables so it is very personable which is exactly how the staff is! It is BYOB which is awesome! 

The table bread was served hot! The smoked mozzarella was to die for! The beef was incredible and the lobster ravioli was out of this world! I wanted the gnocchi but the waiter suggested adding the blush sauce from the gnocchi to the ravioli and adding shrimp. Hands-down best decision ever!

The cannolis were just the right amount of sweetness and the perfect way to end a meal!
Absolute must for Italian food. It's a very small place so try to RSVP a table ahead of time especially if you're with a large group. See photos for food. Very tasteful and filling portions

My parents and I visited this restaurant for the first time last night and all had a great experience! We decided to grab dinner here before the flyers game. Reservations at 530, left the restaurant around 630 and got to the stadium by 7. It can be difficult to find parking in this area, but there are a good amount of spots open on broad st as long as you don't mind walking a bit.

Extremely small and very intimate restaurant. If I were to guess, I'd say it can only seat 30 people. Service was outstanding and very professional.

Appetizer we ordered the grilled octopus with cold potato salad. 10/10 my mom wished she ordered this as her entree! Octopus was grilled to perfection, very tender and flavorful. The cold potato in the lemon sauce was a very nice touch. This was on the special and I highly recommend ordering it! 

My mom ordered the Spaghetti alla scoglio. Very generous portion with seafood and the white wine sauce was light that it made eating this so easy. There was a tiny kick in this dish. 9/10. I ordered one of the specials, which was grilled swordfish w/calamari and shrimp, potato and zucchini. Extremely tender and fresh. Cooked perfectly and I have zero complaints. A lighter and healthier meal, and extremely filling 9/10

The star of the show was my dads entree, which was another special. He ordered the lamb osso bucco and wow *chefs kiss! The pasta was handmade and absolute perfection. Meat was tender and fell off the bone. The red sauce was not extremely strong, but also not weak. Had the perfect balance with a lot of flavor. This was 11/10 amazing! 

For dessert, we all shared the tiramisu. This was the only dish that was just okay. Flavor was all there but the cream was frozen. We thought it was ice cream at first. I prefer my tiramisu soft and creamy rather than frozen. Still solid dessert.

Highly recommend this restaurant and I will be back!

Had the pleasure of visiting L'Angolo this past week.   Excellent Service, Excellent Food and Excellent atmosphere .  Easiest to take a taxi or Uber as this place sits right in the middle of residential row homes in south Philly. 
This is a must go.
What a delight!  I had to force myself to stop eating!  Everything was wonderful!  Can't wait to come back!  We ate in the kitchen. So quaint.  Love this place!
Excellent food, great ambiance, excellent service! Hidden gem! Highly recommend for a date night or authentic Italian food!

Old school Italian restaurant, very small but somehow the servers get around the obstacle course without incident. The portions are very big so come prepared to eat. The seafood grill is good but a bit salty for my taste and the gnocchi was delicious. The servers are attentive. Don't skip the desserts.

I have been to many Italian restaurants over the years. L'Angolo moved right into my top 3 of all time.  During the past weekend I took my family to the restaurant to celebrate my birthday. The entire experience was fantastic. The food was amazing and the service was outstanding. If I was looking for any negative it would be the parking. Always a challenge in South Philly.   I had the pork chop special. Wow would some it up. So tender and full of flavor with the fig reduction sauce.  Can't wait to go back!!!  Oh Yeah it is a BYOB to boot!!!

First time at this old-school restaurant and absolutely loved it. Every single thing we ordered was top notch: Caesar salad, grilled octopus, mozzarella app, chicken parm and chicken piccata. Will be going back at least monthly. F it, maybe tomorrow.

Came down to Philly from NY with my girlfriend for the weekend and we wanted o dine at an old school neighborhood Italian joint.  There were quite a few to chose from and we selected L'Angolo.  A) I love BYOBs B) This place was a HOME RUN.  Super small and quaint.  Absolutely a family kind of vibe.  You have to walk past the kitchen to get to the 10 table dining area, but we loved it.  Our server was great, didn't catch his name but he was attentive and just a nice guy.

The food was amazing.  Started with beet salad, burrata & farro and the grilled pulpo over potatoes (a MUST).  I had veal parm & she had gnocchi with shrimp.  The gnocchi had to be homemade, like little pillows.  I wouldn't be surprised if my spaghetti was homemade also.  You can tell quality pasta after eating it for 40 years :)  The veal parm was perfect.  We didn't have room for dessert.  Prices are very good, as you get quality for your dollar here.  This joint will be a staple for when we visit again.

Very authentic Italian with limited seating but worth the drive 

The mascarpone cheesecake was amazing and it reminders me of the cheesecake I had back in Italy.
L'Angolo upholds the reputation of great South Philly Italian restaurants. Wonderful. Just go. Note BYOB.
ah-maz-ing! everything tasted wonderful. there is gluten free pasta available. the tiramisu was incredible. it's BYOB wine. wish i could eat here for every meal.

This was our first dine in experience since the pandemic broke over a year ago. We couldn't have made a better choice. The food was sublime; the service was outstanding, and the experience was truly memorable. We had a selection of small plates, followed by the specials, and finished with dessert. It was a fantastic meal. We will most definitely return to this South Philly neighborhood gem.
Ordered Grubhub while we were at the PHL airport.    So much better than the restaurant downstairs.   Food was amazing, especially the grilled romaine salad and the chicken parm.
Fookin fuego. From salad to dessert everything we enjoyed was amazing. Great service and personality by the wait staff. I'd give this place 6/5 stars if I could.
Fav Italian spot in the city! Must try, great vibes! If you are in south Philly it's the perfect date spot

We love this place. Food is wonderfully & thoughtfully prepared and the service is always attentive, informative and personable. 
I've never seen a sad face here; families and friends joyously enjoying the company and atmosphere. 
Give great consideration to the specials... last night's grilled octopus appy and seafood pomodoro specials were both exquisite... and popular throughout the house!

What can I say but amazing! Kudos to the owners, chefs (who were working really hard) and servers and busser for a wonderful experience. Every dish was phenomenal and the portions are generous. We had the farro and burrata app along with the octopus app and they were both great to share. I had the brazino grill that was enough for 2 but I ate it. Anyway go there and it's BYOB. I will go back.
This place is SO good!! BYOB with an amazing menu of authentic Italian......funky fun place.

This hidden gem is nestled on a small street in South Philly. It's a BYOB with outside seating if you want to dine alfresco. Inside is small, quaint and nice ambiance. I ordered the beet salad and Chicken Picatta. The salad was delicious and my entree was cooked perfectly. Tiramisu for dessert. This place never dissapoints I will be back again soon. Thanks John and Carlos for your hospitality

First time visit to this little South Philadelphia gem. The biggest challenge of your evening might be parking. The food was amazing and the people were even better. We will back again before our next Sixers game. This place is also a BYOB so bring a bottle of your favorite vino. Enjoy !!!

The food was fantastic and made to order its small but everyone was great our waiter was personable and accommodating then we find out he was the owner john was just a great guy I recommend this place highly

They don't deserve a star. Me and my partner had a very strange experience here several years back where the owner claimed the kitchen was closed several hours early and his friend and patron got into an aggressive argument with him and kept telling us "he was just being an asshole" and that the kitchen wasn't closed. We didn't want to be imposing, so we left. Wasn't until the restaurant down the street did the same thing (with a packed dinning hall staring at us) that we realized it was because we were Black and you can still be that openly racist down here in South Philly. I think about it every time I pass this place.

Found this place while looking for an authentic Italian family owned place. It was absolutely wonderful! We accidentally first went to the wrong place and were late for our reservation but they held on to our table even though we were a party of 5. The service was super warm and friendly. The ambience was cozy and very homely with a great vibe. And the food was insanely delicious. We got the beet salad, the wild mushrooms, burrata and octopus as appetisers - all of which were great. My fav was the burrata and the octopus. Our mains were the lobster ravioli, pork chops, branzino and eggplant pasta out of which the pork chops and the eggplant pasta were beautiful. Dessert is a must with their tiramisu and chocolate torte! Excited to come back soon!

Probably my favorite restaurant in the entire city.  I've eaten here many times and since meeting my husband it has become one of his favorites as well.  Consistently delicious.  I was raised by an Italian immigrant and the food is up to my uber-high standards for food from the Old Country.  I've picked L'Angolo for several birthday dinners over the years.

A friend who lives in MD got to know and love L'Angolo during his time as a student at Penn, and he and his family recently drove up from MD for dinner.  They were desperate for a Covid break and decided a 3 hour drive to have dinner was worth it.  Indeed it was. :)

YASSS! Not a negative word to ever say about L'Angolo. I have been coming to L'Angolo since I moved to South Philly a few years ago. My go to Italian spot has always been Giorgio on Pine, but L'Angolo has definitely taken more of my money in recent months (even during covid). What I like is that they change up their specials, which Giorgio stopped doing (no shade though). The staff are great & so welcoming. I'm one of those people that need to feel comfortable in a small spot like this, I don't want to feel out of place or like I shouldn't be there and this is NOT that place. The food is incredible. Everything. Just go and eat and eat some more.

This place never misses. Bring your own wine. Roasted artichokes make a great appetizer. Have not had a bad dinner here have visited many times. The staff and other customers have always been super friendly. The place is small, intimate. Romantic. .

My wife, family members, and I have been coming to L'Angolo for almost 15 years - it is hands down our favorite Italian restaurant in the city. We celebrate birthdays, anniversaries (my wife and I got engaged here) and special events at L'Angolo and John and his staff are always warm, inviting and professional.

As to their food, it's outstanding. One favorite of ours is their sauteed artichoke hearts with roasted garlic - they are absolutely delicious. So, don't pass up the chance to experience one of the best meals you will ever have. 

Go to L'Angolo!
The best Italian restaurant in the heart of south Philly ! You'd be a fool to pass on L'Angolo

First and foremost this place is BYOB so make sure you bring a couple of bottles. It's a very small and quaint place. The food was fine the service could have been better I think. I personally wouldn't go out of my way to go to this restaurant again. There are other Italian restaurants in the city, obviously not very many, that have better service and the food is just as good. When we visited we were a party of four and we were rushed to leave while we were still eating our dessert. If the service had been more efficient maybe we could've ordered our food and not spend our time waiting for our waiter to come to us.
Best pasta dishes I've ever had. Hands down!! Service was great and I will be back. Best Italian food in South Philly.

Truly a gem. We were getting takeout during covid and everything was perfect as it always is but it's nice to be able to dine in and see the most welcoming and hardworking staff. Although I have never had a bad meal from there, my favorites are the Caesar salad, Smoked mozzarella, eggplant, and the farfalle with crabmeat. Husband always gets the Scoglio which is out of this world as well. Save room for dessert!

Delicious meal as always! Hidden gem South Philly spot, everything we've had is delicious. Can't beat their homemade and fresh dishes. The gnocchi is my go-to because it's my fav, but like to try a bite of what my fiancé gets, from pasta with seafood to lamb osso bucco last night, all great. The burrata appetizer special is a favorite too. Don't skip dessert either, the tiramisu is on point. They are doing a good job with limited indoor dining and sidewalk seating to make the best of  the times. The owner, John, and staff are so friendly and accommodating too, def a spot to check out!

The farfalle w/ crabmeat should just be on the menu like always. Its delicious and the crab is not skimped! 

The lobster ravioli was very creamy but quite delicious as well. What I loved about it was that it was plumb and actually filling. It wasnt overpriced and sad looking like when you see it at those fancy restaurants that want to make lobster ravioli sound like some gourmet special.

They had a burrata special that was on top of I guess it was farro? Some sort of grain. Wasn't sure if I would have liked it but it was an absolute love.

The branzino mixed grill was the only thing I wasn't all that excited about. Don't get me wrong, there was nothing wrong with it. But after bites of the other dishes, this felt a little bland to me.

This hidden gem tucked away on Porter in South Philly is the definition of amazing. My Girlfriend and I discovered L'Angolo during Covid. Having outdoor seating brought us here, delicious from scratch Italian food and the best staff kept us coming back (They also have great GLUTEN FREE pasta). John & Mario are two of the friendliest people you would ever want to meet, they serve up the best service and food you could ask for. Also they are BYOB, after you enjoy some wine with dinner be sure to try the espresso. Im sure you'll agree this place is amazing.

We've dined here many times over the years, always very good, last nights dinner was outstanding. The service e was friendly and precise.The spicy shrimp pappardelle and the mixed grilled seafood were incredibly fresh and well prepared. Our burrata and farro appetizer was delicious. Cant wait to dine on Porter street again
Might be the best Italian in South Philly. And as we all know, that's saying something. The place is old school, comfortable, and delicious. Everything about it is great.

Love this place-
It is a terrific BYO Italian restaurant. It is close to the stadiums, so great for before or after a game.
Most dishes are homemade and incredible. They told us , if we did not see something on the menu, they would try to make it for us.

Located right in the heart of South Philly. This place is such a gem. The pasta tastes authentic and absolutely phenomenal. I tried the Grilled Calamari as an appetizer  and the Farfalle w/ Crab Meat, which was a special. Both were amazing. The calamari was tender and perfectly grilled. My pasta dish was generously portioned with a ton of crabmeat. Thanks for not skipping out on either. Can't wait to be back to try more off their menu!

one of the best meals we have ever eaten in philadelphia!!! we took our three boys and their significant others there for an "after christmas get-together" and boy were we pleasantly surprised!! we had 5:00 reservations and arrived at just that and were seated promptly.  we had an array of appetizers - from salad to burrata cheese to roasted vegetables and were not disappointed by any of them. they went just as fast as they came out.(what did you expect with all these boys!?!?) everyone ordered an entree; from pork milinase , spaghetti allo scoglio , lobster ravioli to braciole- and everything was fantastic!!!!  the only disappointment was we (or should i say the restaurant) did not leave any room for dessert, which all sound delicious!!  the service we received was excellent as well. we were having such a nice evening, our time got away from us and we were actually asked to leave because other people were waiting to be seated.
my one son loved it so much he posted a review on his instagram page - jonnygoodeats   we will definitely  be revisiting l'angolo's- we have to try the dessert afterall!!!!!
My favorite South Phila BYOB!  Intimate setting and great homemade pastas.   Consistent quality and atmosphere.   Make reservations because the dining room can fill up quickly.   Highly recommend!
This is some of the best food I've ever had. Small and cozy. BYOB and the service is always amazing.

Had our pre-race dinner at L'Angola on Friday night, and it was just what we needed. We were a party of 6 and had a reservation for 8pm. As we walked to our table, we noticed the restaurant is a bit small and even with many groups of people eating, the tables were nicely spaced out and we didn't feel crammed. To start we had some appetizers to share: fresh mozzarella caprese, the spiedini, and the grilled shrimp and calamari. I really wished the portions of the appetizers were bigger, especially the grilled shrimp and calamari because it was just so freakin' good. But at L'Angola, you really don't have to worry about portion sizes, because they make sure you're fed, all right. For our entrees, a couple of us ordered the lamb ossobuco special, which was an enormous large shank with the bone still sticking out, with house made pasta on the bottom. Our group also had the shrimp and parppadelle special, the gnocchi, spaghetti scoglio, and the fish of the day which was a swordfish.  The servings were huge, and everything was authentic and delicious. By the end of dinner, everyone was so stuffed. But we still made room for dessert and shared two chocolate tortes, a cannoli, and tiramisu. My favorite was the chocolate torte but have to say the tiramisu was pretty good too.  Overall, it was a fantastic meal, and our wait staff was amazing from start to finish. For the authenticity and amount of food you're getting, everything was reasonably priced too. And, it's BYOB, what more can you ask for?

This is our go to restaurant service is great they treat you very well and the food is so good. It is BYOB but they are so kind and caring. The gravy actually taste homemade, the grilled calamari is fresh and the seafood melts I. Your mouth. If you are looking for posh this is not the place for you but if you are looking for good food around here.

Early dinner before a concert. Always a great meal with reasonable prices. Portions are large. Service is good despite the fast pace and confined space. We had ceasar salad, mozzarella and zucchini and beet salad appetizers. Spaghetti with meat sauce and the chicken and mushrooms. For dessert the cannolis and flourless cake and lemon ice.  Parking takes perseverance but is doable.

This is a cozy little restaurant with amazing food! Be sure to make reservations as there are not a lot of tables but it is worth it. I went with a group of 6 and got the gnocchi with Shrimp and the gnocchi melts in your mouth. Best gnocchi I have ever had!! Sorry grandma!

The most authentic Italian food in Philadelphia. 
The atmosphere and see was beyond exemplary.

Good meal and great little place! My mom was visiting and we decided to stop in for dinner. The restaurant is tiny but feels like you're eating in a bistro in Italy. The service was wonderful and we would definitely go back. 

We had the Caesar salad, special faro and Burrata salad, veal Milanese, and a shrimp pasta dish from the specials. The Caesar salad was one of the best I've ever had - chopped and bits of cheese and dressing spread Throughout every bite. The pasta dish was just OK, but everything else was great.

The place filled up quick I would recommend making a reservation. They are also BYO. 

Great find, I will definitely be going sbc
